paragraphs.text: And that hope looks like full-screen ads. Stuck in between your friends’ Stories, it’s impossible to ignore them — your whole screen literally becomes a giant ad. You can’t block them. You have to watch.
paragraphs.name: fbd1
9eac
paragraphs.text: If you’re not a fan of full-screen content, the future is looking pretty bleak. Pushing the feature to (almost) all of its products, Facebook shows it’s going all in. If the rest of the industry neglects the move, there’s a chance most things will stay the same. But if they take notes, we might soon be tapping through a seemingly endless stream of terrible, full-screen ads.

virtuals.metaDescription: In the last six months Instagram, Whatsapp and Messenger all copied Snapchat. What’s up with that?
virtuals.subtitle: I hope you like ads.

5a2a0d07c8a5.title: People have proven their adversity to intrusive advertising so, as has happened with other forms of…

paragraphs.name: 897f
paragraphs.text: People have proven their adversity to intrusive advertising so, as has happened with other forms of advertising (adblockers, tracking killers and the like) it won’t take the industry long to deal with this new ‘strategy’. This will continue until advertisers and publishers learn that unless advertising is relevant and adds value to the user experience, it’s just junk that needs to be discarded.

virtuals.subtitle: Making software available only on the cloud (SaaS), instead of selling true ownership of the software, just opens up possibilities for…

d68c2d06ead9.title: This is why I still use email to communicate instead.

content.subtitle: Making software available only on the cloud (SaaS), instead of selling true ownership of the software, just opens up possibilities for…

paragraphs.name: fad4
paragraphs.text: This is why I still use email to communicate instead. There is no possibility for an intermediary to push ads in my face, because there is no middleman. Also, it supports all formats, video, pictures, text, html, whatever I want to send, it’s easy to select who gets to see each message, and to “share” (forward).

virtuals.subtitle: Not to mention, great that Medium might make money out of this, but how do I!? Do I get a cut when the ads get plastered on my stuff?

57c68b6fab17.title: So far I find Medium’s series thing kinda weird and clumsy.

content.subtitle: Not to mention, great that Medium might make money out of this, but how do I!? Do I get a cut when the ads get plastered on my stuff?

paragraphs.name: c594
paragraphs.text: So far I find Medium’s series thing kinda weird and clumsy. I also don’t like that I have no idea how long anything is at the start. I like to know what I’m getting into before I’m 30 minutes in and no end in sight. I’m still not that big a fan of reading, much less creating content, on my phone. I prefer my laptop and a full keyboard to work with…
